column4:
Tonight I'm hosting the second of two urgent town halls focused on voting safely and securely in the middle of a pandemic. 

Join us at 6:30 PM by RSVPing here: https://t.co/DrgKYOvhyw 

#VotingTownHall

I'll be hosting the first of two urgent town halls tomorrow morning at 10 AM focused on voting safely and securely in the middle of a pandemic. 

RSVP here to reserve your spot: https://t.co/aE5Q54vk0a

#VotingTownHall https://t.co/67bJuuNFf3

So many in the child welfare system are facing the same issues Deshala is facing. 

The bipartisan Pandemic Protection for Foster Youth Act will prevent youth from aging out of foster care and Chafee services during the COVID-19 pandemic response.
https://t.co/gNa9n6WrUk

214,000 Americans are dead because of a pandemic you mismanaged. 

Hundreds of thousands of businesses are closed. 

Millions are unemployed. 

Keep my name out of your mouth. Get back to work. https://t.co/ro5ZX64Pz3

RT @OutFrontCNN: Democratic Rep. Karen Bass says President Trump’s response to the US surpassing 200,000 Covid-19 deaths was “pathetic.”

“…
A vote to confirm Donald Trump's nominee to the Supreme Court is a vote to take health care away from millions of Americans and to rewind the progress of women’s rights in this country by decades.
The main motivation for Donald Trump to fill the Supreme Court vacancy is to take away health care from millions of Americans in the middle of a pandemic.

Bill Barr comparing the sale of human beings to public health professionals trying to save lives is abhorrent but consistent with Trump's desire to stoke racial tension in this country. 

Despite their efforts, we will come together. 

I have faith in the American people. https://t.co/J6nh0zUOIg

Absolutely irresponsible and dangerous. The unnecessary deportation of 300,000 family members, neighbors, and co-workers in the middle of a pandemic will help the spread of COVID-19.  
https://t.co/WGsLYPUa9F

This year, we mark #HispanicHeritageMonth as we confront a pandemic that has disproportionately impacted communities of color.

I join in celebrating the contributions of Latinos and Latinas throughout this nation’s history, including those on the frontlines fighting every day.

Donald Trump knew COVID-19 was dangerous. 
He knew it was contagious.
He knew it was airborne.
He knew it was deadly.

He just didn't care. 

The first job of the Commander in Chief is to protecting and defending the United States. 

He failed.

RT @PostOpinions: People of color are disproportionately affected by covid-19.

Yet they are underrepresented in vaccine trials, @RepKarenB…

Making the decision to force hundreds of my constituents to go to new designated locations for their mail in the middle of a pandemic is absolutely unacceptable.

I am in contact with both the post office and the Housing Authority working to get to the bottom of these changes. https://t.co/iWVudTXMuh

Jacob Blake.
COVID-19.
Assault on our elections.

Join me and @TIME tomorrow at 1pm ET for #TIME100Talks.

https://t.co/2my1JFbs4F https://t.co/Ux8YeZX5J3
Younger people, older people, and everyone in between — wear a mask. https://t.co/iE1jipNtCW
$75 billion for testing, tracing, and treatment has been sitting on Mitch McConnell’s desk for 102 days.

About 10,000 Americans have died due to COVID-19 since this interview aired. 

“It is what it is.”
https://t.co/69ZVj2jdHV

RT @Elex_Michaelson: .@RepKarenBass on Congress' inability to pass the extra $600 in relief for the unemployed during #coronavirus?

"I'm s…

Two weeks ago, @GReschenthaler, @RepKClark and I introduced the Protecting the Health and Wellness of Babies and Pregnant Women in Custody Act to provide a national standard of care for pregnancy-related needs of incarcerated women.

As we celebrate 55 years of the Voting Rights Act, our work to ensure access to the ballot isn’t over. 

Congress must pass the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Act and we must give states the resources they need to #ProtectOurVote amid the COVID-19 crisis. #VRA55

When I worked in a trauma center, sometimes we’d have young patients.

The thing about young people is they have no choice but to rely on adults for advice and guidance. 

In a hospital, that trust is a matter of life or death.

Kids are not immune to COVID-19. Listen to science.

I had a telephone town hall last night. 147 of my constituents told me they're at risk of eviction due to the expiration of their COVID benefits. 

That’s 147 too many. 

We passed legislation to address this 82 days ago. The Senate must act. The people need assistance NOW.

This picture is from a month and a half ago when I had to tell Louie Gohmert to put his mask on so that we could finally start our hearing. He did so reluctantly. 

Now, 44 days later, he's tested positive for COVID-19. 

Listen to current (and former) health professionals. https://t.co/zeSPGwnfEV

It’s worse than that. WHILE he wasn’t wearing his mask, he specifically went around telling people he’s tested negative multiple times so there was nothing to worry about. You can test negative one day and positive the next. Listen to science. https://t.co/xuyYWZXuTf

The United States accounts for 4% of the world’s population but 23% of reported COVID deaths worldwide. 

Donald Trump and Michael Pence are abject failures.

Last month, Vice President Pence wrote "we are winning the fight against the invisible enemy." 

40,000 Americans have died since then. 

We're not testing where we should be. The virus isn't contained. This is the United States of America, when will there be a national strategy? https://t.co/lPCMxYvCdb

Donald Trump is incapable of empathy and doesn't believe in science.

He's the last person who should be briefing the American people about the coronavirus. https://t.co/9Fj2v8bGDl

Today, Donald Trump sent well wishes to Ghislaine Maxwell, who is charged with procuring underage girls to be sexually abused. 

Has he sent any well wishes to the families of the more than 140,000 Americans who have died during this pandemic?

Putting a child in juvenile detention in the middle of a pandemic for not completing her homework is child abuse. Grace’s life is now in danger. 

It’s not just our Black sons who are failed by this system, it’s our Black daughters too. 

It’s all of our children. https://t.co/tmR5E0LbTN
More people have been arrested for protesting the murder of Breonna Taylor than for the actual murder of Breonna Taylor.

Today, on the 14th day of July, Los Angeles had the highest number of new cases and hospitalizations reported in a single day during the pandemic.

The country is not “rocking” again. https://t.co/Xfoj8xUIbA

More than 138,000 Americans have died of COVID-19.

Unconscionable.

The fact he was released in the first place was outrageous.

There are thousands of elderly, high-risk individuals who committed non-violent minor crimes who are being forced to risk their lives in prison amid a pandemic.

They need to be released. https://t.co/BSTjZ2miWq

The move to withdraw from the World Health Organization in the midst of a pandemic highlights this administration’s gross mismanagement of this global health emergency and a complete abdication of international responsibility and leadership.
Wear a mask. https://t.co/GYniLq5J6Z
Why fill out the census? Children’s Healthcare. https://t.co/Lv6ko4FvDb https://t.co/EarcB1ToEb

There are 1.3 billion people in India. Less than 15,000 people there have died because of the coronavirus.

There are 328 million people in the United States. More than 120,000 people here have died because of the coronavirus.

Absolutely outrageous. https://t.co/ITnXrxDl5t
Wear a mask. https://t.co/m4xB8HvyIk
What we want is to do is decriminalize social, economic and health problems in our society by reinvesting and reimagining the way we address public safety in this country. 5/5

Like many, I’m frustrated with the distortion of the defund movement by the Right which is just trying to divide us.

Remember that these are the same people who are always ready to defund healthcare, defund education, defund mental health services. 3/

We have not invested in health, social or economic problems in our communities and we leave the police to pick up the pieces. 

Police officers should not be responsible for cleaning up society's problems. 

We need to rethink public safety and invest in solutions that work. https://t.co/m414Z03Iex

RT @TheBlackCaucus: Join us today for Living While Black in America. 

COVID-19 stopped everything, except racism. https://t.co/auXID0zclD…

We are hosting a nation-wide town hall meeting tomorrow to discuss what it is like to live while Black in America.

COVID-19 stopped everything... except for racism.

https://t.co/RG4AHoKlwI https://t.co/f1qMISpVub

It feels like it's open season on Black folks not just because of the police murders, but because of the police brutality.

We're stopped if we're not wearing medical masks. Meanwhile, armed vigilantes are taking over the Michigan state capitol unbothered.

Where is the justice? https://t.co/W5fgVYASKu

.@TheBlackCaucus will be hosting a nation-wide town hall on Friday. 

COVID-19 has stopped everything except for racism. 

Join us: https://t.co/RG4AHosKFa https://t.co/7vnMM092xO

100,000 people in the richest country in the history of the world have died because of COVID-19.

If we had acted aggressively and much earlier, how many of the 100,000 would be alive today?

Failed leadership.

100,000 lives.
100,000 stories.
100,000 loved ones.

Gone.
RT @AliVelshi: The CDC’s new report on coronavirus racial disparities is only 2.5 pages & contains no new data: top Dems are calling it a “…

https://t.co/yftIdq7nme

DJay’s death is a sad reminder that there is no time to waste to act on behalf of our nation’s foster youth. As this pandemic continues, it’s critical that we make sure everyone in this vulnerable population has the coverage and the care they need. 4/

Last week, DJay passed away due to complications with COVID-19.
 
On Friday, @RepGwenMoore and I will be reintroducing legislation to immediately ensure that eligible former foster youth have access to Medicaid until the age of 26 in his honor. 3/

He was an advocate through and through – a champion for health care reforms for current and former foster youth and other changes to our child welfare system. He wanted to make the world a better place than he found it.

And he did. 2/

There are 90,000 dead from COVID-19 in the richest country in the world.

There are 1.5 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the richest country in the world.

There are 36 million initial unemployment claims because of COVID-19 in the richest country in the world.

Why?

I wonder if the President knows that hydroxychloroquine can damage your heart. I wonder if he knows people have died trying to treat themselves with this drug that medical science rejects as a treatment for COVID.
The impact this pandemic is having on our nation's foster youth cannot be overlooked. We must raise #FosterYouthVoices. https://t.co/w5L7uLJAHT

Are you a teacher during this pandemic? @TheBlackCaucus wants to hear from you.

https://t.co/RG4AHosKFa https://t.co/TQv0JR5JGZ

Ebony's father has been in prison for 31 years. He told her men have been making masks out of underwear from the commissary to protect themselves during this pandemic. 

This is absolutely unacceptable. https://t.co/hGuxhncbtZ

On Friday, the Trump administration vetoed a United Nations resolution that called for a global ceasefire in conflicts to collectively focus on the COVID-19 pandemic.

We have the most deaths and the most infections in the world.

What will it take for this to be taken seriously?

Under the leadership of this administration during this pandemic, the United States now has the most CASES of COVID-19 in the world, the most DEATHS from COVID-19 in the world, and the highest unemployment rate since the Great Depression.
You can't tell the general public to do social distancing, wear masks and wash their hands and then have the exact opposite in a prison.

The disproportionate impact this pandemic is having on our communities will be exacerbated in states opening before health officials are advising them to. https://t.co/9vFuUMWnle https://t.co/ptcvIgpHOK

We're in a pandemic. No one should be in jail because they violated parole by missing a meeting. No one should be in prison because they couldn't make $1,000 bail.

Thanks to @theonlyjasonlee, @MissMelyssaFord, @TheRealDJDAMAGE and the @HollywoodUL team for raising this issue. https://t.co/WwlDZnZsOd
No one's 18 year-old daughter should have to go every day wondering if her mother is going to die from COVID-19 while serving a 60-month sentence in prison. https://t.co/4KvGv7llgz

This May, we come together to celebrate the experiences of the youth who are in, or have been in, the child welfare system and raise awareness about their needs -- especially in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.

It is critical now more than ever to raise #fosteryouthvoices. https://t.co/mMl9SlqWaO

Pregnant women who are incarcerated should not be in tiny prison cells during a global pandemic.

Andrea Circle Bear should not be dead right now and neither should the 30 other federal prisoners who have passed away due to COVID-19. https://t.co/gcTTBtRN7M

"My partner is serving 12 years for a drug charge. He needs your help so this doesn't become a death sentence." 

Alice is a nurse on the frontlines of this pandemic. 

She should not have to wake up every day and wonder if her partner is going to die of COVID-19 in prison. https://t.co/3kkkRsuNhZ

While iftar and taraweeh traditions will be different this year, we wish health, peace and blessings to all observing. Ramadan Mubarak!

Our community is on fire in this pandemic.

As we saw last night, earthquakes do not wait for pandemics to be over.

This is wrong. https://t.co/G3DtusK5hv

We are in the midst of a global pandemic.

Nearly one in every four deaths WORLDWIDE is an American and yet here you are, attacking the Speaker because she has the courage, leadership and competence the nation needs right now.

Now is the time to use race-based data to finally address these disparities.

And we must. 5/5

More brothers and sisters will be infected, more mothers and fathers will be admitted to already struggling hospitals and more grandparents will die.

#ProtectAllWorkers #GetMePPE

It was wrong to do it before this pandemic, and it’s especially wrong to do it now. #UpChafee

The disproportionate COVID-19 infection and death rates among African Americans are manifestations of longstanding structural inequalities in this country.

It's Public Health Awareness Week.

There should be COVID-19 tests being performed right now in every single prison and jail in this country.

We make up only 14.1% of the state’s population. 1/

They are in our hospitals, our factories, and our grocery stores.

It’s the beginning of the month.

Landlords in the City of Los Angeles are prohibited from evicting residential tenants during this emergency period if the tenant is unable to pay rent due to circumstances related to the pandemic.

Know your rights: https://t.co/kl63cJltyp

Millions of people have lost their job in the past month, and with it - their health coverage. A special enrollment period could have extended the opportunity for them to seek out newly-needed coverage.

The President is incapable of feeling empathy for another human being. https://t.co/utQWQHSgG7

Focus on getting people their much-needed checks like Congress has ordered you to do. 

Focus on following the recommendations of the health professionals around you. 

Focus on coordinating an INTERNATIONAL coalition to address this crisis. 

Focus on doing your JOB.

Here’s an idea: 

Focus on getting our hospitals respirators. 

Focus on getting our medical professionals sufficient equipment. 

Focus on taking central command of resources so states don’t have to bid against each other for supplies.

Mr. President, would you PLEASE focus on the pandemic that has now caused more than 100,000 infections and 2,300 deaths in the US and not worry about Duchess Meghan Markle and Prince Harry?

She was a constituent of the 37th Congressional District and is welcome home any time. https://t.co/KaBUQTp1j2
Having people confined in close quarters becomes a breeding ground for the virus. We must do everything we can to combat this spread. 6/6

A week ago, there were around 8,000 cases of COVID-19 in the United States. Since then, that number has multiplied by ten. 

It is shameful that the world's richest country has the most cases in the world. 

This was mishandled from the beginning and left our country unprepared. https://t.co/vb4YVdsHWM

Last week, there were 15,219 reported cases in the US of COVID-19. 

Now, there are nearly 85,000.

Last week, 206 people in the US had died because of COVID-19. 

Now, it's more than 1,000. 

Be careful and be safe. Nothing is more important than your health.

We have to stay strong.

We have to follow public health guidelines.

We have to make sure we do everything we can to make sure our community gets through this crisis. 

https://t.co/z08Mh8MeDS https://t.co/KGfS1smHtV

https://t.co/Auj5adc2Wr

I used to work in an ER that often was often low on supplies. We've been sending health care workers to war to fight a war with pool noodles instead of swords. https://t.co/np1ADkhHBO

Instead of the intelligence and expertise of South Korea, Donald Trump is emulating the sycophancy, incompetence and propaganda of North Korea. 
https://t.co/Lf7c4a4sVD

South Korea has tested more than 230,000 cases with a population of about 50 million. 

To be on track with South Korea, we would have needed to test about 1.5 million people. 

We’ve conducted less than 20,000 tests.

We just voted for the American people.

Affordable treatment for all — patients must be reimbursed for any non-covered coronavirus-related costs, or else the epidemic will be worsened because Americans will fear they cannot afford the costs associated with treatment 7/

Widespread and free coronavirus testing — the administration must ensure that all Americans who need an evaluation are able to access locations for cost-free testing and rapidly increase the unacceptably low daily test processing capacity inside the U.S. 6/

Clear protections for frontline workers — we must have clear standards & sufficient distribution of necessary protective equipment for health care & other workers who are in contact with people who have been exposed as well as the people who clean those facilities 5/

Food security — we must expand SNAP, WIC, school lunch and other initiatives and suspend implementation of any regulations that weaken federal food assistance, in order to ensure vulnerable populations do not lose access to food during this epidemic 4/
Enhanced Unemployment Insurance — we must ensure unemployment insurance benefits are available and sufficient for workers who may lose their jobs from the economic impacts of the epidemic 3/

Paid sick leave — workers impacted by quarantine orders or responsible for caring for children impacted by school closures must receive paid sick leave to alleviate the devastating consequences of lost wages. 2/

[THREAD]: In the midst of this outbreak, the administration must prioritize the health and safety of American workers and their families over corporate interests. 

Here's how: 1/
If we want to stop the spread of this disease, there needs to be paid sick leave and free testing. Period. https://t.co/8h8k3VRwzJ

This will add to the trauma already experienced by the child but also data shows that cases become unreasonably and unacceptably unfair when they take place by video.

The actual amount recorded turned out to be less than 2% of that because of Obama’s international fight against the disease.

Obama on Ebola: “Don't standby thinking that somehow because of what we’ve done... it’s taken care of. It’s not.”

That's where we are with the Coronavirus. https://t.co/1NNGsCo40S

Today, Congress takes action.
